result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Lavender was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  
Sentence credit of 52 days was granted.
Concurrent with: any sentence currently being served.

superMiscConds.notes: AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. Absolute Sobriety. No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.

Obtain/Maintain full-time employment.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Restitution for Victim A to be paid during term of confinement and as a condition of extended supervision.
Costs to be paid during term of confinement and as a condition of extended supervision.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Wang advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

3:11 PM Defendant Thomas Lavender in court, in custody.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Thomas Lavender.  Prosecuting attorney Kristi J Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State has complied with victim's rights. 
Case called for plea and sentencing.
State places the offer on the record.
Court conducts plea colloquy.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. 
Count 2 is Dismissed and read in.
State and Defense make sentencing recommendations. 
Victim makes statement to the court.
Defendant makes statement to the court.

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:

6  YEARS OF IMPRISONMENT (Credit: 52 Days)
3   YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
3   YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
Concurrent to:  any sentence currently being served; 

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed;
*Obtain/Maintain full-time employment;
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done;

RESTITUTION:  $529 to Victim A (Restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
COSTS:  $268     
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250     
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
**To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Confidential Crime Victim Info CR-247
Motion and Order to Seal Victim Impact Statement, Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on September 7, 2022.
to Seal Victim Impact Statement(s)
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.  **Rescheduled due to conflict with the Court's calendar.**

to the Court filed by Atty. Angela Wang requesting a plea/sentencing date.

**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 08/25/22--approved; set for Plea/Sentencing as quickly as possible but within enough time for the State to comply with any victims rights.**
Hearing on November 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:20 AM Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas Lavender in court, in custody.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Thomas Lavender. City of New Berlin Police Department Officer Jeremiah Johnson sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Will. Cross examination by Attorney Wang. Redirect by Attorney Will. State rests. State moves for bind over with argument. Attorney Wang objects to bind over without argument. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant is not to use/possess any burglarious tools.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.
